title: How to Make Brandied Sweet Cherries

steps.headline: Sterilize each of the jars in advance.
Clean the cherries using water in a colander.
steps.description: Pick off any stems and pierce each cherry with a toothpick.

steps.headline: Distribute the cherries into each jar evenly.
Add 2 tbsp of sugar per jar.
Pour brandy over the cherries in each jar, until almost the top.
Seal the jar and shake gently.
steps.description: Give a few more shakes over the next day.

steps.headline: Store the jar in a cool.
steps.description: Leave the cherries to steep in the brandy for at least two months before use.

steps.headline: Serve or gift.
steps.description: Serve with ice cream, cake, as part of a fresh fruit salad etc. If gifting, add a lovely ribbon and label that states what the ingredients are and that you made it yourself.

text: Sterilize each of the jars in advance.  Clean the cherries using water in a colander. Pick off any stems and pierce each cherry with a toothpick. Distribute the cherries into each jar evenly.  Add 2 tbsp of sugar per jar.  Pour brandy over the cherries in each jar, until almost the top.  Seal the jar and shake gently. Give a few more shakes over the next day. Store the jar in a cool. Leave the cherries to steep in the brandy for at least two months before use. Serve or gift. Serve with ice cream, cake, as part of a fresh fruit salad etc. If gifting, add a lovely ribbon and label that states what the ingredients are and that you made it yourself.
